briefdescription.para: Compile time constant representing what kind of schema this class is.
Construct a PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowAPI on UsdPrim prim .

detaileddescription.para: Equivalent to PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowAPI::Get(prim.GetStage(), prim.GetPath()) for a valid prim, but will not immediately throw an error for an invalid prim

briefdescription.para: Construct a PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowAPI on the prim held by schemaObj .

detaileddescription.para: Should be preferred over PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowAPI(schemaObj.GetPrim()), as it preserves SchemaBase state.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.
The yaw angle of the follow vector around the subject.

detaileddescription.para: Zero is directly behind the subject. e.g. 0 degrees

briefdescription.para: See GetYawAngleAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The pitch angle of the follow vector around the subject.

detaileddescription.para: Zero is directly behind the subject. e.g. 15 degrees

briefdescription.para: See GetPitchAngleAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Time constant to filter the pitch angle, in seconds.

detaileddescription.para: Used to pitch the camera up and down when driving up or down hills. e.g. 0.2 seconds

briefdescription.para: See GetPitchAngleTimeConstantAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Scale of the camera pitch angle at slow speed.

detaileddescription.para: This lowers the camera behind the subject at slow speeds. e.g. 0.5

briefdescription.para: See GetSlowSpeedPitchAngleScaleAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Scale of the camera pitch angle at slow speed.

detaileddescription.para: This lowers the camera behind the subject at slow speeds. e.g. 1000 cm/sec

briefdescription.para: See GetSlowPitchAngleSpeedAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The minimum speed, below which, the subject look vector must be used because the normalized velocity vector is too erratic.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. 600.0 cm/sec

briefdescription.para: See GetVelocityNormalMinSpeedAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The minimum speed used for a linear interpolation to compute the follow distance of the camera.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. 300.0 cm/sec

briefdescription.para: See GetFollowMinSpeedAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The minimum distance used for a linear interpolation to compute the follow distance of the camera.
See GetFollowMinDistanceAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The maximum speed used for a linear interpolation to compute the follow distance of the camera.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. 3000.0 cm/sec

briefdescription.para: See GetFollowMaxSpeedAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The maximum distance used for a linear interpolation to compute the follow distance of the camera.
See GetFollowMaxDistanceAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Time constant to filter the subject yaw rate, in seconds.

detaileddescription.para: Use to look into turns. e.g. 0.2 sec

briefdescription.para: See GetYawRateTimeConstantAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: A scale factor that multiplies the filtered yaw rate to yaw the camera position behind the subject.

detaileddescription.para: Can be any positive or negative number. e.g. 0.2

briefdescription.para: See GetFollowTurnRateGainAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Filter time constant for the position of the camera for each axis, in seconds.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. (0.5 sec, 0.1 sec, 0.5 sec)

briefdescription.para: See GetCameraPositionTimeConstantAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Position offset from the subject center of mass from which the camera follow vector and look vector are computed.
See GetPositionOffsetAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The minimum speed used for a linear interpolation to compute the look ahead distance of the camera look point.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. 0.0 cm/sec

briefdescription.para: See GetLookAheadMinSpeedAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The minimum distance used for a linear interpolation to compute the look ahead distance of the camera look point.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. 0.0 cm

briefdescription.para: See GetLookAheadMinDistanceAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The maximum speed used for a linear interpolation to compute the look ahead distance of the camera look point.
See GetLookAheadMaxSpeedAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: The maximum distance used for a linear interpolation to compute the look ahead distance of the camera look point.
See GetLookAheadMaxDistanceAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: A scale factor that multiplies the filtered yaw rate to yaw the camera look point left or right.

detaileddescription.para: Can be any positive or negative number. e.g. 0.2

briefdescription.para: See GetLookAheadTurnRateGainAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Distance to elevate the camera look point.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. 50.0 cm

briefdescription.para: See GetLookPositionHeightAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Filter time constant for the camera look point, in seconds.

detaileddescription.para: e.g. (0.2 sec, 0.5 sec, 0.2 sec)

briefdescription.para: See GetLookPositionTimeConstantAttr(), and also Usd_Create_Or_Get_Property for when to use Get vs Create.

detaileddescription.para: If specified, author defaultValue as the attribute's default, sparsely (when it makes sense to do so) if writeSparsely is true - the default for writeSparsely is false.

briefdescription.para: Return a vector of names of all pre-declared attributes for this schema class and all its ancestor classes.

detaileddescription.para: Does not include attributes that may be authored by custom/extended methods of the schemas involved.

briefdescription.para: Return a PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowAPI holding the prim adhering to this schema at path on stage.

detaileddescription.para: If no prim exists at path on stage, or if the prim at that path does not adhere to this schema, return an invalid schema object. This is shorthand for the following:

briefdescription.para: Applies this single-apply API schema to the given prim.

detaileddescription.para: This information is stored by adding "PhysxCameraFollowAPI" to the token-valued, listOp metadata apiSchemas on the prim.

simplesect.para: A valid PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowAPI object is returned upon success. An invalid (or empty) PhysxSchemaPhysxCameraFollowAPI object is returned upon failure. See UsdPrim::ApplyAPI() for conditions resulting in failure.

briefdescription.para: Returns the type of schema this class belongs to.
PhysX camera that follows behind the subject as it moves.
